chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
The defendant George Edgar Lee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: DE competent to stand trial, suspension lifted

records.addlTxt: DE is competent
Jury trial on January 17, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on January 9, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant George Edgar Lee in court with attorney Michael Hughes.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls Dr. Knudson.  Court sworn in Erik Knudson, testifies.  Atty. Hughes direct doctor.  State stipulates doctor as an expert.  Marked exhibit 1.  State objects to exhibit - not relevant given the date.  Atty. Hughes makes argument.  Atty. Hoffman doctor didn't make a full evaluation.  Court rec'd exh. 1.  Atty. Hoffman cross exam.  Atty. Hughes redirect.  Atty. Hoffman has Dr. Gust Brey awaiting by phone for her testimony if atty. and court would like to hear her report.  Court calls Dr. Gust Brey and sworn in.  Atty. Hoffman direct of Karyn Gust Brey.  Atty. Hughs cross exam.  Evidentiary portion completed.  Atty. Hoffman states position - DE is competent.  Atty. Hughes makes argument - State has not proven burden that DE is competent.  Atty. Hughes believes not competent. Atty. Hoffman makes burden.  Court takes recess at 4:16 pm.  Back on the record at 4:31 pm.  Court addresses substantial mental capacity to understand the proceedings or to assist in his defense.  Court places more value in Dr. Gust Brey's testimony than the other doctors and explains why.  Court finds DE is now competent to proceed.  DE will be returned to custody and cases will proceed.  Court orders current medication to continue during the duration of the proceedings.  Matters will be set for further hearing.  Atty Hughes states he can now inform Dr. Knudson that he can now proceed w/his NGI analysis.  Court notes that is correct.  Court is adjourned.
Copy of examiners report mailed to Attorney Hughes and copy to the District Attorney's Office.
Karen Gust-Brey
Mendota
Competency hearing on November 4, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Competency hearing on October 27, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant George Edgar Lee in court with attorney Michael Hughes.  Defendant George Edgar Lee in custody.  Dennis Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases.  Parties state appearances.  Atty Hughes calls Dr. Elliott Lee - S&T by phone.  Atty Hughes has exhibit #1 marked and ID'd.  Court receives #1.  State does cross-exam of Dr. Lee.  Atty Hughes does re-direct.  Court questions witness.  Witness excused.  Atty Hughes states there is no other doctor ready as the other doctor he needs to have testify isn't available today.  Atty Hughes calls the DE - S&T from counsel table.  Atty Hughes has exhibit #2 marked and ID'd.  Atty Hughes moves for exhibit #2 to be received.  Court receives #2.  State has no questions.  Testimony closed for today.  Court will go off the record to get a new court date for the final doctor to testify.  Competency hearing scheduled for October 27, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Mendota
Competency hearing on September 30, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant George Edgar Lee in court with attorney Michael Hughes.  Defendant George Edgar Lee in custody.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  Atty Hughes state DE feels he is not competent so they would request the hearing proceed today.  State is ready to proceed and calls Dr. Karen Gust-Brey - S&T by phone.  State moves doctor's report into evidence.  Court receives report.  Atty Hughes does cross-exam.  No re-direct.  Witness excused.  State has no further evidence.  Atty Hughes states he has two doctors and the DE to call.  State objects to the doctors being called and explains why.  Atty Hughes responds.  Court overrules objection by State/will need to hear from DE witnesses.  Court goes off the record to discuss scheduling this for further hearing.  Back on the record the Court finds that he has run out of time for this hearing today and will reset this as soon as possible.  Court notes that since the hearing was originally scheduled w/in the time limits and has now begun that they have met the time limit requirements.  Competency hearing reset to September 30, 2016 at 11:00 am.  Competency hearing scheduled for September 30, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Mendota
adjourning competency hearing

Karyn Gust-Brey, Ph.D.

records.addlTxt: for commitment for treatment

Defendant George Edgar Lee in court with attorney Michael Hughes.  Defendant George Edgar Lee in custody.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties received and reviewed report by Dr. Elliott Lee.  State and Atty. Hughes do not wish to present any more evidence.  Defendant agrees.  Medications to be administered are agreed upon per Dr. Lee's recommendations.  Court states based upon report,  DE not competent at this time to stand time, may thru medication, committ to DHS for further treatment.  All 3 cases are subject to this order.
